pullRequest.body:
Split up the file `RingTheory/Algebraic.lean` into a few subfiles:
* `Algebraic/Defs.lean`: definition of algebraic and transcendental elements and (sub)algebras
* `Algebraic/Integral.lean`: relate `IsAlgebraic` and `IsIntegral`
* `Algebraic/Basic.lean`: most results on showing certain elements are algebraic (this is probably the file you want to import afterwards)
* `Algebraic/LinearIndependent.lean`: showing certain families are linear independent using transcendentality
* `Algebraic/MvPolynomial.lean`: results on multivariate polynomials
* `Algebraic/Pi.lean`: a definition of algebraic function (which seems to be unused otherwise). See also [mathlib3#11156](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/11156).

I don't expect a particularly exciting import reduction, but it does clean up the file structure somewhat, in particular by moving the relation between algebraic and integral elements to one dedicated place (which had been irritating me for years!).

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

- ...

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|219|-1|bare open (scoped) Classical|

Current commit [3b0ebb2e19](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/3b0ebb2e19a749fe32e2584fcfeb58510331da2d)
Reference commit [f801de4934](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/f801de4934457721044d87bd482f67a3219c30c1)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Great work! Do you have plan to also split `AlgebraicIndependent` (in another PR)?

> Great work! Do you have plan to also split `AlgebraicIndependent` (in another PR)?

I haven't looked deeply at that file but I'll put it on my TODO list!

Something like this:

```suggestion
# Transcendental elements in `MvPolynomial`

This file lists some results on some elements in `MvPolynomial σ R` being transcendental
over the base ring `R` and subrings `MvPolynomial.supported` of `MvPolynomial σ R`.
```
Maybe `variable (R S T : Type*)` is OK in this file, since we don't use R, S, T in the other places of this file, and we don't use `Cardinal.lift`, etc. which requires explicit universe levels.
Do you think it's a good idea to move this result as well as some other simple results depends only on `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.AlgebraMap` to `Defs.lean`?

#find_home says this can be moved to Mathlib.Algebra.MvPolynomial.Equiv.
It seems to be a special case of [Polynomial.aeval_algHom](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/AlgebraMap.html#Polynomial.aeval_algHom) though.

pullRequest.title: chore(RingTheory): split up `Algebraic.lean`
